bibl.title: Flight Club: The New Archilochus Fragment and its Resonance with Homeric Epic.
bibl.note: P. Oxy. LXIX, 4708 (= M.-P.3 122; LDAB 327). - 1. Introducing a Homeric Archilochus. - 2. Reading the new Archilochus as an ""anti-Iliadic"" flight to the ships: 2.1. ""Let's give up on Troy"": Agamemnon's flight to the ships; - 2.2. ""Should I stay or should I go?"": Odysseus addresses his heart. - 3. Reading the new Archilochus as an Odyssean tale: 3.1. ""Let me tell you a story"": Odysseus' songs of flight; - 3.2. ""There they drank a lot"": epic battles vs sympotic play; - 3.3. ""Telephos all by himself routed the Argives"": Archilochus' anti-epic narrative. - 4. ""A shield no worse"": new Archilochus and old.

bibl.title: Materiali e discussioni per l'analisi dei testi classici

bibl.seg: Elton T.E. Barker & Joel P. Christensen, Flight Club: The New Archilochus Fragment and its Resonance with Homeric Epic.

P. Oxy. LXIX, 4708 (= M.-P.3 122; LDAB 327). - 1. Introducing a Homeric Archilochus. - 2. Reading the new Archilochus as an ""anti-Iliadic"" flight to the ships: 2.1. ""Let's give up on Troy"": Agamemnon's flight to the ships; - 2.2. ""Should I stay or should I go?"": Odysseus addresses his heart. - 3. Reading the new Archilochus as an Odyssean tale: 3.1. ""Let me tell you a story"": Odysseus' songs of flight; - 3.2. ""There they drank a lot"": epic battles vs sympotic play; - 3.3. ""Telephos all by himself routed the Argives"": Archilochus' anti-epic narrative. - 4. ""A shield no worse"": new Archilochus and old.
